days.title: Main Hall - Friday

items.title: Opening Ceremony
items.description: Starting with an enchanting procession from the bar, the Opening Ceremony will introduce our guests, the committee and the programme.  Wow!

items.title: Bits and Pieces
items.description: Dave Trace hosts a quiz, shows bits and goes to pieces.

items.title: Book Launches — The Jackdaw's Choice
items.description: New books are presented to all and sundry.

items.title: Things That Go Bump on Friday Night
items.description: Radio play of Popplestein.

items.title: Concert — Paradox of Ravens
items.description: Anne Hunt and our very own Sara Pattern make their debut together as a band with an 80s electric vibe.

days.note: The dealer's room is NOT open to convention attendees on Friday. However, gaming space is available in the adjoining hall.

days.title: Main Hall - Saturday

items.title: Talk — Things We Grew Up With
items.description: David Trace leads a discussion of film, TV, books and Bagpuss.

items.title: Guest Interview — Dominic Glynn
items.description: Our guest composer tells us about being catchy creative, surviving Doctor Who in the eye of the storm and his bad day.

items.title: Lunch Break — HP LunchCraft
items.description: The challenge is laid down.  Is it more scarf?  Organised by Vicky Vagg.

items.title: Auction
items.description: Fantastic, incredible and must-have items to bid on and buy!

items.title: Auction Wrap-Up
items.description: The time for the people who have bought items to pay and collect.

items.title: Guest Interview — Jaine Fenn
items.description: Gary Loveridge interviews Jaine Fenn about her books, re-enactment and video games.

items.title: Panel — Writers Discuss Their Craft
items.description: Last year was publishing, this year it’ll be the actual writing – we hope.  Adele Andersen, Jaine Fenn, Tracey Norman and David Wake discuss the craft.

items.title: Dinner
items.description: Yum-yum.

items.title: Talk — Drake #1: History and Reason
items.description: It’s been a long time since this has been revisited and thousands of exoplanets have been discovered.  Gary Loveridge explains the equation and its history.

items.title: Entertainment — Excitement Galore!
items.description: Join us for a light-hearted evening of stuff.

days.note: We encourage you to wear costumes during the day and we’ll award floor prizes.

items.title: Talk — The Castaways of Terrene
items.description: Both the author and the main character of this YA novel are autistic – 12-year-old Luca and his mum, Emily, talk about their unique writing process when self-publishing this sci-fi mystery together.

items.title: Talk — Drake #2: Astronomy and Biology
items.description: Gary Loveridge explains the astronomy and Dr Bob explains the biology as they attempt to put numbers to the equation to tell us all how many Extraterrestrial Intelligences there are in the galaxy.

items.title: Lunch Break — HP LunchCraft
items.description: Munch, munch

items.title: Reading — Jaine Fenn
items.description: Jaine Fenn reads from her stories.

items.title: Guest Interview — David Fernández Girón
items.description: David talks about his extraordinary work on films such as Man of Steel, Solo: A Star Wars Story, Avengers and John Carter as well as his traditional and digital painting.

items.title: Guest Interview — Charlotte Merrill
items.description: Charlotte talks about her brilliant work on Sherlock Holmes, Batman, Harry Potter, Cloverfield, V for Vendetta and Ex Machina.

items.title: Guest Panel — Creativity with Constraints
items.description: Our guests, Jaine Fenn, Dominic Glynn, David Fernández Girón and Charlotte Merrill talk about working on video games, film and TV, and how that impacts their creative freedom.

items.title: Raffle
items.description: Did you win anything? Let's find out.

items.title: Closing Ceremony
items.description: Including the Jeremy Ogden award.

items.title: Millidave's, the Restaurant at the end of the Convention
items.description: A relaxed meal with ArmadaCon friends to celebrate the end of this year’s convention. Be sure to book your space IN ADVANCE at the ArmadaCon registration desk.
